verses.roman:
kutas tasyānubhāvaḥ syāt
teja īśatvam eva vā
yo 'nvagacchaṁ striyaṁ yāntīṁ
khara-vat pāda-tāḍitaḥ

synonyms: kutaḥ—where; tasya—of that person (myself); anubhāvaḥ—the influence; syāt—is; tejaḥ—strength; īśatvam—sovereignty; eva—indeed; vā—or; yaḥ—who; anvagaccham—ran after; striyam—this woman; yāntīm—while going away; khara-vat—just like an ass; pāda—by the foot; tāḍitaḥ—punished.
translation: Where are my so-called great influence, power and sovereignty? Just like an ass being kicked in the face by his she-ass, I ran after that woman, who had already given me up.
